content.description: This route is located on the right edge of the Chinos Slab. Climb the thin bolt protected crux to a flake system with small gear. Top out on bigger holds. A nice sustained short climb.
content.location: Right edge of the Chinos Slab

climbs.name: Handrails
climbs.fa: George Hurley, David Giampietro & Joe Perez    Oct, 26 2012

content.description:
Start 5' right of Gamma Ray at a large oak tree. Follow handrails up and right until near the top. Amble left on obvious holds to the top. 

  A good beginner lead!
Climb up a right angling crack placing gear to a stance (bolt). Pull the thin crux moves to a second bolt. Continue up the right leaning arete past a third bolt and finish at a tree anchor.
content.protection: I used a .75 and #2 Camelot low then 3 bolts to a tree anchor.

content.description: On the far left end of The Chinos Slab. Climb up a  featured moderate slab past two spaced bolts to the right leaning arete. Clip the third bolt and continue up the crux arete into a niche with a two bolt anchor. The climb may feel easier or harder depending on how you climb the finish.
content.location: Left edge of the Chinos Slab

content.description: Start roughly 15' left of Cross Roads East near a large pine. Climb up and right past two bolts to the "cross roads." Angle left on good holds to the top.
Start 20' left of Rick's Route by a large oak tree. Follow the left slanting crack to the "cross roads", the angle right up the crack to the top.

climbs.name: Abstinence
climbs.fa: Joshua Corbett, James Dickson and Jonathan Garlough

content.description: Start by making a couple of crux moves pass two bolts, then itÂ’s on to flakes and jugs. This is a great warm up for the other climbs on the slabs.
content.protection: Two bolts, one small C3 and some big stuff to BD #4
content.location: This is the obvious crack and flake system n the middle of the slab. It starts at the toe of the cliff.

content.description: From The Main Cliff walk 100 yards climbers left to The Chinos Slab.
